hotspots.label: Large Eye
hotspots.fact: This lizard has big eyes that help it see insects and other small animals to eat. Good eyesight is an important body part that helps this reptile survive in its habitat. Animals have different body structures that help them find food and stay safe.

vocabulary.definition: A special body part or behavior that helps an animal survive and do things it needs to do, like hunting for food.

hotspots.label: Bumpy Scales
hotspots.fact: The bumpy texture you see on this green lizard's skin is made of tiny scales that protect its body, just like armor! Scales are a special feature that all reptiles have to keep their skin safe and healthy. This is called **adaptation** â€” a special body part that helps animals survive.

vocabulary.definition: Tiny overlapping pieces of hard skin that cover a reptile's body to protect it and keep it from drying out.

hotspots.label: Green Color
hotspots.fact: This lizard's bright green color helps it blend in with leaves and trees in its environment, so predators have a harder time seeing it. This special coloring is called **camouflage**, and it's an important adaptation that helps the animal stay hidden and safe. The color helps the lizard survive in its natural habitat.

vocabulary.definition: Colors or patterns on an animal's body that help it blend in with its surroundings so other animals can't see it as easily.

hotspots.label: Strong Jaw
hotspots.fact: This reptile has a long, strong jaw that helps it catch and eat small insects, spiders, and other tiny animals. The shape and strength of its jaw is a special body part that shows how this animal is built to hunt and survive. Different animals have different mouth shapes depending on what they eat.

vocabulary.definition: An animal that hunts and eats other animals to survive.
